docs.lead_paragraph: Reaction to the White House's demand Sunday that Congress, through its intelligence committees, investigate whether former President Barack Obama abused his executive powers in connection with that campaign. Obama has denied Trump's claim, offered without evidence in a series of tweets Saturday, that Obama had the telephones tapped at Trump Tower during the 2016 campaign.

headline.print_headline: What People Are Saying About White House Call for Inquiry

docs.lead_paragraph: Germany opposes a proposal by France and Italy to use bonds to finance a new 5 billion euro (4.32 billion pounds) European Union defence research fund, saying it would not be a viable way to finance European military projects, according to the Handelsblatt newspaper.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bahrain's top government advisory body passed a constitutional amendment allowing suspected militants to be tried in military courts on Sunday, state news agency BNA reported, in a move criticized by activists.
